title: What is the single discount percent equal to three successive discounts of 40%, 25%, and 15%? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are multiple ways to solve it. Here I'll show you 2 ways as others are already discussed in different answers. Method 1: the formula 2 successive discount are calculated by formula a+b -a*b/100 So for 40% and 25% 40+25–40*25/100 65–10=55% Now for 55% and 15% 55+15–55*15/100 70–8.25 =61.75% You can use this formula for any number of successive discount cases. Though I don't recommend this procedure as it involve lot's of calculation, it has its own use in some cases. Method 2: converting % into fraction and successively multiplying it 40% discount is =60% 60%=3/5 75%=3/4 and 85%=17/20 = 3*3*17/(5*4*20) =153/400 Net discount % = (1–153/400)*100 =247/4 =61.75% Hope this helps.

If “M”- is the Marked price of an article and if 3- successive discounts of 40% , 25% and 15% are allowed then the Sale Price=Mx(1–0.40)(1–0.25)(1–0.15) =M x 0.60 x 0.75 x 0.85=M x 0.350625= M x 0.3825Therefore the single discount percentage equivalent.= (1–0.3825) x 100 =61.75%.

response.answer_text: We know that every value is a 100% value in it's own so MRP is also a 100% value These are three successive discounts or percentage decrease of 40% , 25% and 15% Initial value is 100% First time it is decreasing by 40% Whenever a value decreases by 40% it remains (100–40)=60% After first decrease the new value is 60 Second time it is decreasing by 25% Whenever a value decreases by 25% it remains (100–25)= 75% 75% of 60 will be (60*75)/100 or 45% After second decrease the new value is 45 and third time it is decreasing by 15% Whenever a value decreases by 15% it remains (100–15)= 85% 85% of 45 will be (45*85)/100 or 38.25% Original value was 100% but after three successive decrease now it is 38.25% Total % decrease = (100–38.25) = 61.75% So a single ℅ discount equavalent to three successive discounts is 61.75%

response.answer_text: Use a $100 for easy calculation. $100 - ($100 x 40%) = $100 - $40 = $60 $60 - ($60 x 25%) = $60 - $15 = $45 $45 - ($45 x 15%) = $45 - $6.76 = $38.25 $38.25 is the final price after all the 3 discounts of 40%, 25% and 15% ($100 - $38.25) x 100% = $61.75 x 100% = 61.75% Therefore the single discount percent equal to three successive discounts of 40%, 25% and 15% is 61.75%
